meanings.sent1: The craftsman discarded the slumgum as it was of no use in making the jewelry.
meanings.sent2: The factory produced a lot of slumgum that had to be disposed of.
meanings.sent3: The children used the slumgum to create a pretend treasure map for their game.
meanings.sent4: The slumgum of lies and deceit tarnished his reputation beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds of slumgum hung over the once peaceful village.

meanings.definition: To gather or collect in a disorderly manner
meanings.sent1: She had to slumgum all her belongings quickly before the storm hit.
meanings.sent2: The kids would slumgum toys from all over the house when playing.
meanings.sent3: He tried to slumgum his thoughts before the important presentation.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to slumgum the fallen leaves into a chaotic dance.
meanings.sent5: The crowd began to slumgum around the street performer, eager to see the show.

meanings.definition: A mixture of waste or refuse
meanings.sent1: The dumpster behind the restaurant was full of slumgum after the busy weekend.
meanings.sent2: The old shed was filled with slumgum that needed to be cleared out.
meanings.sent3: The slumgum of old newspapers and magazines cluttered the attic.
meanings.sent4: The river carried a stream of slumgum downstream after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned factory was surrounded by a sea of slumgum, a reminder of its past glory.
